channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Can the U.S. claim a law-enforcement justification for entering Venezuela?
item.description: Scott Anderson, an international law expert at the Brookings Institution, weighs the legal case for the U.S. operation in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: Scott Anderson, an international law expert at the Brookings Institution, weighs the legal case for the U.S. operation in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: In Miami, Venezuelans hail U.S. move against Maduro
item.description: Miami has the largest population of Venezuelan ex-pats. Hundreds of people turned out to cheer the news that U.S. authorities took custody of President Nicolas Maduro.
item.content:encoded: Miami has the largest population of Venezuelan ex-pats. Hundreds of people turned out to cheer the news that U.S. authorities took custody of President Nicolas Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Trump says the U.S. will run Venezuela after U.S. seizes Maduro
item.description: President Trump details U.S. plans in Venezuela in the wake of a controversial mission to remove and indict President Maduro.
item.content:encoded: President Trump details U.S. plans in Venezuela in the wake of a controversial mission to remove and indict President Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: What we know about the military operation to capture Maduro
item.description: Details are emerging about how U.S. forces entered Venezuela and seized President Nicolas Maduro.
item.content:encoded: Details are emerging about how U.S. forces entered Venezuela and seized President Nicolas Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Former US Ambassador to Venezuela reacts to U.S. operation to seize Nicolas Maduro
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Top House Democrat on what Congress should do next after Venezuela operation
item.description: U.S. Representative Adam Smith weighs in on the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: U.S. Representative Adam Smith weighs in on the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: Regional and global reactions to the operation in Venezuela
item.description: Leaders around the world react to the U.S. operation in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: Leaders around the world react to the U.S. operation in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Venezuela's government rejects U.S. claims as Caracas shows loyalty to Maduro
item.description: Venezuela's state media condemns the capture of President Nicolás Maduro as pro-government rallies and armed civilian patrols emerge in Caracas.
item.content:encoded: Venezuela's state media condemns the capture of President Nicolás Maduro as pro-government rallies and armed civilian patrols emerge in Caracas.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Is the whiskey industry in trouble?
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with bourbon expert Fred Minnick on what Jim Beam's halting distillation at main distillery reveals about the challenges facing the bourbon industry and the year ahead.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with bourbon expert Fred Minnick on what Jim Beam's halting distillation at main distillery reveals about the challenges facing the bourbon industry and the year ahead.
item.dc:creator: Elena Burnett

item.title: A hike up Mount Kilimanjaro holds lessons for a new year
item.description: As a new year begins, a hike up Africa's highest peak is a reminder that slowing down is sometimes the key to success.
item.content:encoded: As a new year begins, a hike up Africa's highest peak is a reminder that slowing down is sometimes the key to success.
item.dc:creator: Ciara Hulet
